www.lawcommission.gov.np  
1 
 National Indigenous Nationalities Commission Act, 2074 (2017)  
Date of Authentication and Publication:                                            
October 13, 2017 ( 2074.06.27 )  
Amending Acts:  
The Act Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019 (2075)     March 3 , 2019 ( 2075.11.19 ) 
 
Act No. 19 of the year 2017 (2074)  
An Act made to make arrangements relating to  National Indigenous  
Nationalities Commission  
 
Preamble:  Whereas, it is expedient to make necessary arrangements relating 
to National Indigenous Nationalities Commi ssion for the identification of the 
glorious history and culture of Indigenous nationalities, protection and 
promotion of the ir rights and interests and the empowerment  of the 
communities,  
Now, therefore, be it enacted by the Federal Parliament pursuant to 
Article 296 sub -article (1) of the Constitution of Nepal.  
 
Chapter -1 
Preliminary  
 
1. Short title and Commencement : (1) This Act may be called "  National 
Indigenous Nationalities Commission  Act, 2017 (2074)."  
  (2)  This act shall come into force immediately.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
2 
 2. Definitions : Unless the subject or the context otherwise requires, in this 
Act, -  
(a)  "Chairperson" means the Chairperson of the Commission 
 and the word also includes  the Acting Chairperson.  
(b)  "Indigenous Nationalities " means the race or community as 
 defined by the Government of Nepal on the basis of the 
 recommendation  made by the Commission.  
(c)  "Commission" means the National Indigenous Nationalities 
 Commission  established under Article 261 of the 
 Constitution.  
(d)  "Prescribed" or "As prescribed" means laws prescribed or 
 as prescribed under the Rules framed under this Act.  
(e)  "Member" means the member of the Commission and the 
 word also includes the Chairperson.  
(f)  "Constitution" means the Constitution of Nepal.  
 
Chapter -2 
Qualifications of the Chairperson and Members and Vacancy of Post  
 
3. Qualifications of the Chairperson and Members : The following 
 persons shall be qualified to be the Chairperson and Member of the 
 Commission: - 
(a)  Indigenous national having contributed for at least ten 
 years for the protection, promotion of the rights and 
 interes ts of the indigenous nationalities  community , the 
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
3 
  empowerment of the i ndigenous nationalities community 
 or in the human rights or legal field,  
(b)  holding a bachelor's degree in the relevant subject from a 
 recognized university,  
(c)  not being a member of any political party at the time of 
 appointment,  
(d)  having attained the age o f forty -five years,  
(e)  being of high moral character.  
4. Vacancy of post : The post of the Chairperson or Member of the 
Commission shall be vacant in any of the following circumstances: - 
(a)  if he or she tenders resignation in writing to the President,  
(b)  if he or she attains the age of sixty -five years,  
(c)  if the tenure of the post ends pursuant to sub -article (3) of 
 Article 261 of the Constitution,  
(d)  if a motion of impeachment is passed against him or her under 
 Article 101 of the Constitution,  
(e)  if he or she is r emoved from post by the President on 
 recommendation of the Constitutional Council on grounds of 
 his or her inability to hold office and discharge the functions 
 due to physical or mental illness,  
(f)  if he or she dies.  
5. Reappointment shall not be done : The Chairperson and Members 
appointed shall not reappointed.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
4 
    Provided that a member may be appointed to the post of Chairperson, 
and when a member is so appointed as the Chairperson, his or her term of 
post shall be so computed as to include his or her  term as the member.  
6. Not to be appointed in other government service s: A person appointed 
as the Chairperson or a member of the Commission shall not be eligible for 
appointment in other government service s. 
  Provided that, nothing in this clause shall  be deemed to be a bar to 
the appointment to any political position or to any position which requires 
making investigations, inquiries or findings on any subject, or submitting 
advice, opinion or recommendation after carrying out a study or research 
on any  subject.  
Chapter -3 
Power, Functions and Duties of the Commission  
 
7. Power, Functions and Duties of the Commission : The power, 
 function and duties of the Commission shall be as follows: -  
(a)  to conduct study on  the overall situation of the  indigenous 
 nationalities  community and to make recommendations to 
 the Government of Nepal for policy, legal and institutional 
 reforms, in that relation,  
(b)  to formulate national policy and programs for the 
 promotion and protection of the rights and interes ts of the 
 indigenous nationalities  community and the empowerment 
 of such community and to make recommendation to the 
 Government of Nepal for their  implementation,

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
5 
 (c) to conduct stud y and research on whether the provisions 
and arrangements  made for the promotion and protection 
of the rights and interests of the indigenous nationalit ies 
community and the ir empowerment have been effectively 
implemented , and to  make suggestions  to the Government 
of Nepal for the measures to be taken for their  effective 
implementation,  
(d) to make suggestions to the Government of Nepal  regarding 
the reforms in terms of legal, policy and institutional 
measures, required for the promotion and protection of the 
rights and interests of the indigenous nationalit ies 
community and the empowerment of such community,  
(e) to review, monitor and evaluate the implementation of the 
policy and programs related to indigenous nationalities 
community,  
(f) to monitor or cause to be monitored the implementation of 
the recommendations made or suggestions given by the 
Com mission,  
(g) to make recommendations to the Government of Nepal for 
the formulation and implementation of special programs 
for the development and empowerment of economically or 
socially indigent people within the indigenous nationalities 
community ,  
(h) to undert ake studies and research into the language, script, 
culture, history, tradition, literature, art within the

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
6 
 indigenous nationalities communities, and to make 
recommendations to the Government of Nepal for the 
protection and development of such language, sc ript, 
culture, history, tradition, literature, art of such 
communities,  
(i) to conduct awareness generating program for the 
protection and promotion of the rights and interests of the 
indigenous nationalities communities and the 
empowerment of such  communities , 
(j) to formulate  programs to end existing malpractices, 
superstitions and all forms of exploitation existing within 
the indigenous nationalities communities and the 
empowerment of such community and to make 
recommendations  to the Government of Nepal,  
(k) to pro tect and promote the traditional skill, technology and 
special knowledge existing within the indigenous 
nationalities communities and to assist in its application 
for commercial  use,  
(l) to monitor the implementation of the international treaties, 
agreements relating to the indigenous nationalities 
communities  that Nepal is  a party to , and to make 
recommendations or suggestions to the Government of 
Nepal for their  implementation , 
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075) .

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
7 
 (m) to colle ct complaints against the persons or organizations 
that violate the rights of the indigenous nationalities 
communities  and to make recommendation to the 
concerned agency to conduct investigation and prosecution 
over such complaints,  
(n) to identify the indige nous nationalities communities  by 
means of detailed studies and researc h and to make 
recommendations to the Government of Nepal to make 
lists of Surnames,  
(o) to formulate policy and programs to establish and mobilize 
living museum for the protection and prom otion of the 
physical, non -physical culture  of the indigenous 
nationalities communities and to make recommendations 
to the Government of Nepal for their  implementation,  
(p) to search for and investigate the  place of  origin of the 
indigenous nationalities communities and to make 
recommendations to the Government of Nepal for the 
protection and promotion of th ose archaeological and 
ancient structures, objects and places,  
(q) to review, monitor and evaluate the awareness generating 
programs conducted by the Gover nment of Nepal and other 
organizations and institutions for the protection, 
promotion and empowerment of the indigenous 
nationalities communities,

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
8 
 (r) to formulate and implement the code of conduct for the 
Chairperson, Members and employees of the Commission,  
(s) to approve the annual plans and program of the 
Commission.  
8. May obtain opinion and consultations : The Commission, in relation 
 to its functions and duties,  may receive opinions and seek consultations 
 from any constitutional organ, government office or public entity.  
9. May obtain service of experts : The Commission may receive services 
 from experts, pursuant to the federal law by stating the reasons thereof, 
 if the human resource employed within the Commission is unable to  
 perform any work that the Co mmission is required to perform as per the 
 Constitution, this Act and prevailing federal law.  
10.  May form  committee or working group : (1) The Commission may 
 form a committee or working group to perform specific tasks by 
 formulating a procedure.  
(2) The terms or scope of operation of the committee or working 
group formed pursuant to sub -section  (1), shall be as prescribed by the 
Commission at the time of its formation.  
(3) While forming the committee or working group pursuant to 
sub-section  (1), there  shall be representation based on the principle of 
proportional representation, as enshrined in the Constitution.  
11.  Coordination and Cooperation : The Commission may on the basis 
of necessity, coordinate and cooperate with government agencies or 
public entities.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
9 
 Chapter - 4 
Operation of the Commission  
 
12. Office of the Commission : (1) A central office of the Commission shall be 
established within Kathmandu Valley for the operation of work of the 
Commission.  
(2) The Commission may, on the basis of necessity, es tablish offices 
in the provincial  level.  
13. Meeting of the Commission : (1) The meeting of the Commission shall 
decide the activities to be performed  by the Commission  in accordance  
with this Act.  
 (2) The meeting of the Commission shall be  held on such a date, time 
and venue as prescribed by the Chairperson, based on necessity.  
  (3) The Secretary of the Commission shall  finalize and notify all 
members of the date, time and venue of the meeting along with a list of the 
agenda to be discusse d in the meeting, at least 48 hours prior to the meeting .  
 (4) Any member interested to discuss additional issues, not included 
within the list of agenda set to be discussed within the meeting pursuant to 
sub-section (3), shall notify the Secretary of the  additional issue and reason 
for its introduction to the meeting 24 hours prior  to the meeting. Upon 
receipt of such information, the Secretary of the Commission shall notify 
all members and such issue shall be considered to have been included in the 
list.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
10 
  (5) Notwithstanding anything stated in sub -sections (3) and (4), an 
issue not included within the list may be introduced and decided by the 
Commission, with the agreement of all members present in the meeting.  
 (6) The quorum of the meeting shall be de emed to have been fulfilled 
with the presence of more than 50 percent of the immediate members of the 
Commission.  
 (7) The meeting of the Commission shall be chaired by the 
Chairperson of the Commission.  
 (8) The decision of the majority shall be the deci sion of the 
Commission and in case of a tie, the Chairperson shall give a decisive vote.  
 (9) The Secretary of the Commission shall create a depository of the 
decision of the Commission and also authenticate it with the signatures of 
the Chairperson and M embers.  
 (10) The Secretary of the Commission shall be a gazetted first class 
officer of the Nepal Civil Service. The senior most official of the 
Commission shall act as the Secretary of the Commission until the 
appointment of such official.  
 Provided that, in the absence of the special class officer, the senior 
most officer of the Commission shall not be interrupted from being and 
functioning as the Secretary of the Commission.  
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
11 
  (11) Other procedures related to the meeting of the Commission s hall 
be as determined by the Commission.  
14.  Not to take part in the decision making in case of conflict of interest :  
If any member of the Commission has any interest, concern or benefit  
arising from any issue under consideration in the Commission or if  the near 
relatives of such persons stand to benefit directly or indirectly, such 
member should give prior information to the Commission regarding such 
matters and such member shall not take part in the decision making process 
of the Commission concerning such matters.  
15.  Work Division : The division of the work of the Chairperson and Member 
shall be as fixed by the Commission.  
16.  Work to be performed as an acting : The senior most Member of the 
Commission, shall work as the acting Chairperson,  if the po sition of the 
Chairperson falls vacant due to any reason, is unable to perform work 
pursuant to sub -article (6) of Article 101 of the constitution, has gone for a 
foreign visit or is on leave for more than 7 days.   
17.  Work, performance of the Commission not to be interrupted : The 
vacancy of posts of the Chairperson  and/ or any Member shall not 
interrupt the works of the Commission.  
  .................  
 
 
 
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075)  
  Removed by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075) .

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
12 
 Chapter -5 
Miscellaneous  
 
18.  Organizational Structure and Employees of the Commission : (1) The 
organizational structure and appointment of employees of the Commission 
shall be as prescribed by the Government of Nepal.  
 (2) The Government of Nepal shall make available the employees 
necessary for the Commission to perform its work.  
19.  Duties and Conduct of Post:  (1) The duties and conduct of the post to be 
adhered by the Chairperson and Members of the Commission shall be as 
follows:  
(a)  to perform  the obligations of the post independent ly, 
impartially and honestly for the  empowerment of the 
community of indigenous  nationality,  and to protect 
and promote the rights, interests of the community of 
indigenous nationality  community  
(b)  Not to commit any act that would create discord in the 
 relationship between different ethnicities, communities 
 and identities.  
 (2) The Chairperson and the Members of the Commission shall 
adhere to the code of conduct as prescribed by this Act or prevailing federal 
laws.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
13 
 20.  Cooperation to be extended : It shall be the duty of any agency or official 
 with which the Commission seeks assistance, to cooperate with the 
 Commission in course of the performance of its functions.   
21. Power to send for implementation in writing : If the Commission finds 
that any agency or official has has not made available necessary assistance 
to the Commission, it may write to the higher agency or official above such 
agency or official for assistance in the matter.  
22.  Annual report : (1) The Commission shall submit an annual re port of the 
work and activities of the Commission, to the president within three months 
of the date of expiry of the fiscal year.  
 (2) The report made pursuant to sub -section (1) shall inter -alia, 
include the following matters, in addition to other details:  
(a) Details of implementation of annual programs of 
 the Commission and expenses incurred,  
(b) Details of suggestions, recommendations given by 
the Commission to Nepal  Government or any other 
agency,  
(c) The status of the implementation of the suggestions, 
recommendations given in accordance to clause (b ),  
(d) Situation of physical and economic resources of the 
Commission and their utilization,  
(e) Details of other activities performed by the 
Commission in course  of fulfilling the 
responsibilities required to be performed by it, in 
accordance to this Act.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
14 
  
23.  Liaison with Government of Nepal : The Ministry of Federal Affairs and 
 General Administration  shall liaise the Commission with the Government 
 of Nepal.  
24.  Delegation of Power : The Commission may delegate some a uthority 
 accorded to it by this Act, as per necessity, with set conditions for its use 
 and adherence, to the Chairperson, Member, Government of Nepal, State 
 Government, official employee of any agency or Local Government.  
25. .....................  
26. Protection of the action taken in Good Faith : No legal proceedings shall 
 be initiated against the Members of the Commission, employees or any 
 person deputed by the Commission for any action performed under this 
 Act or rules framed under this Act , in good faith.  
27. Power to frame rules : (1) The Commission  may frame necessary rules 
 for the implementation of this Act.  
  (2) The Commission sha ll have to get the approval of the 
 Government of Nepal, Ministry of Finance , while making rules pursuant 
 to subsection (1), on matters that impose financial burden or liability on the 
 Government of Nepal.  
                                                           
  Amended by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075) . 
  Repealed by The A ct Amending Some Nepal Acts 2019  (2075) .

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
15 
   (3) The rules made pursuant to sub -section (1) shall come into 
 force, from the date of publication in the Nepal Gazette.  
28.  Power to frame Directives : The Commission may, subject to this Act or 
 rules framed under this Act, issue directives to conduct or cause to conduct 
 the smooth operation of its work.

www.lawcommission.gov.np  
16 
 Schedule  
.............................
